intro: Dissochaeta glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular dissochaeta, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Poaceae, or grass family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant is native to certain regions of South America, particularly in Brazil and Argentina. Its leaves are typically narrow and have a hairy surface, which may aid in water retention in arid environments. Dissochaeta glandulosa is often found in grasslands and open habitats, where it plays a minor role in the local ecosystem.
